title: Large-Scale Multi-Representation Mathematics Learning Program for Students with Hearing Impairments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Elementary-Level Basic Mathematical Concepts
context.additional_context: Utilization of digital content tailored to the visual learning characteristics of hearing-impaired students

learning_goals: Students can explain the geometric meaning of linear equations with 80% accuracy using multiple representations (visual graphs, animations, textual explanations).
Learners can solve fraction operation problems with 90% accuracy through interactive digital textbooks.
Students can convert real-life problem situations presented in formative assessments into visual models and solve them with over 75% success.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
